content.title: Integrated Agriculture Training Centre Scheme
content.details: The 'Integrated Agriculture Training Centre (IATC) Scheme' was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to provide training for enhancing the skills of farmers besides imparting updated agricultural technologies to departmental functionaries. Awareness Programmes/ trainings conducted periodically.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture.
content.application_process: Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the bonafide farmers can approach the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a Community Development Block/Agriculture Circle.
documents_required: Documents proof of being a farmer

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The 'Integrated Agriculture Training Centre (IATC) Scheme' intends to provide training for enhancing the skills of farmers besides imparting updated agricultural technologies to departmental functionaries. Awareness Programmes/training conducted periodically.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers of Meghalaya engaged in agriculture are eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can approach the nearest Agriculture Development Officer of a CD Block / Agriculture circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first served basis.

faqs.question: Whom to contact?
faqs.answer: District Agriculture Officers of the concerned districts, Sub-Divisional Agricultural Officers of the concerned sub-divisions, District Training Officers, Tura/Shillong, Agricultural Development Officers of the concerned Community and Rural Development Blocks.
